title: Law Enforcement Dispatched Calls for Service: Closed
description: Note: All call locations are mapped to nearby intersections to ensure anonymity. Call locations reported before April 24, 2024 are currently mapped to a slightly different set of intersections than those reported on or after April 24. This may result in slight reporting irregularities for analyses that span this date. We will harmonize all historical data and resolve this as soon as possible. A. SUMMARY Dispatched Calls-For-Service – Closed Calls includes all calls for service which generate a record in the Department of Emergency Management's Computer Aided Dispatch (CAD) System, and typically have a law enforcement unit dispatched to the location. Calls originate from the public via calls to the 911 call center or from law enforcement officers in the field upon viewing an incident (‘On-View’). The Closed Calls dataset includes only calls for service that have been closed, and is updated every 24 hours, to include the initial call type, final call type and call disposition. Not all Calls for Service generate a Police Incident Report, so data does not directly correlate to the Police Incidents Report dataset. All relevant time intervals are also included. Dataset contains calls handled by law enforcement which can include Police, MTA parking enforcement, the Sheriff’s Office, and others. Some Calls for Service data is suppressed, due to the nature of the call and privacy concerns related to the incident. Please refer to the Dispatched Calls for Service Explainer for full documentation B. HOW THE DATASET IS CREATED Once a received 911 call is dispatched, a record (CAD#) is generated in the Department of Emergency Management's Computer Aided Dispatch (CAD) System. C. UPDATE PROCESS Updated daily at 2:00am with previous days data. D. HOW TO USE THIS DATASET Please refer Dispatched Calls for Service Explainer for full documentation. Note: As of 12/22/23, Law Enforcement Calls for Service data related to calls that originated from the 311 Connected Worker app and were dispatched from the Healthy Streets Operations Center (HSOC) have been recoded to better capture the nature of these calls. These calls were previously categorized as "on view" calls and were hard to distinguish from other types of "on view" calls for service where a San Francisco Police Department unit were dispatched based on viewing an incident in the field. They will now be identified using a new value in the onview_flag data field of "HSOC." This affects historic data as well as new data in the Law Enforcement Calls for Service datasets. E. KEY RELATED DATASETS Datasets: Law Enforcement Dispatched Calls for Service: Real-time Police Department Incident Reports: 2018 to Present Fire Department Calls for Service Geographic Boundaries: Current Police Districts Analysis Neighborhoods Supervisor Districts

columns.name: cad_number
columns.description: Unique 9-digit number assigned by the 911 Dispatch Center (DEM) to this call. Both Police and Fire Depts use these numbers.

columns.name: dup_cad_number
columns.description: If a call is later determined to be related to a single incident that received multiple dispatched calls, this field will be populated with the related CAD number.

columns.name: pd_incident_report
columns.description: If a police incident report is created as a result of this call the report number will be found here.

columns.name: received_datetime
columns.description: Date and time when the 911 Dispatch Center receives the call or, when onview_flag = Y, an officer initiates an on-view incident

columns.name: entry_datetime
columns.description: Date and time when the 911 operator submits the initial call information into the CAD system or, when onview_flag = Y, an officer initiates an on-view incident

columns.name: dispatch_datetime
columns.description: Date and time when the 911 operator dispatches the first unit to the location of the incident or, when onview_flag = Y, an officer initiates an on-view incident

columns.name: enroute_datetime
columns.description: Date and time when the first unit acknowledges the dispatch and records that they are enroute to the location of the incident or, when onview_flag = Y, an officer initiates an on-view incident

columns.name: onscene_datetime
columns.description: Date and time the first unit records arriving at the location of the incident or, when onview_flag = Y, an officer initiates an on-view incident

columns.name: close_datetime
columns.description: Date and time when the last unit responding closes the call

columns.name: call_type_original
columns.description: Call type code as originally coded/selected by dispatcher

columns.name: call_type_original_desc
columns.description: Standard description of original call type

columns.name: call_type_original_notes
columns.description: Any notes regarding the original call type entered by the dispatcher

columns.name: call_type_final
columns.description: Final call type code as coded/selected by dispatcher. For closed calls this is the last call type code. For open calls this code may continue to change.

columns.name: call_type_final_desc
columns.description: Standard description of final call type

columns.name: call_type_final_notes
columns.description: Any notes regarding the final call type entered by the dispatcher

columns.name: priority_original
columns.description: Priority level originally coded by dispatcher

columns.name: priority_final
columns.description: Final priority level for closed calls and most recent priority level for open calls

columns.name: agency
columns.description: Primary agency assigned (Police, Sheriff, or MTA). Multiple units from different agencies may respond, but only one agency will be identified as the primary responder.

columns.name: disposition
columns.description: Disposition of call

columns.name: onview_flag
columns.description: Indicates whether the associated cad_number originated from a 911 call (onview_flag = N) or from a law enforcement unit viewing an incident in the field (onview_flag = Y). The third value, "HSOC", indicates the case was created via 311, routed to the Healthy Streets Outreach Center and logged in the computer aided dispatch system.

columns.name: sensitive_call
columns.description: Indicates whether the call is of a sensitive nature. Location information & call notes are not provided for sensitive calls.

columns.name: intersection_name
columns.description: Name of intersection used to anonymize the incident location

columns.name: intersection_id
columns.description: Unique ID for the intersection_point used to anonymize the incident location

columns.name: intersection_point
columns.description: Geographic point representing the anonymized incident location (nearest intersection)

columns.name: supervisor_district
columns.description: Supervisor District based on anonymized intersection coordinates

columns.name: analysis_neighborhood
columns.description: Analysis Neighborhoods based on anonymized intersection coordinates

columns.name: police_district
columns.description: Police District based on anonymized intersection coordinates

columns.name: data_as_of
columns.description: Timestamp when data for this call was last extracted from the source CAD system

columns.name: data_updated_at
columns.description: Timestamp when data for this call was last processed

columns.name: data_loaded_at
columns.description: Timestamp when data for this call was last loaded here (into the open data portal)

columns.name: source_filename
columns.description: Name of the file from which this call was extracted

columns.name: Neighborhoods
columns.description: This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Neighborhoods' (jwn9-ihcz) the point in column 'intersection_point' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

columns.name: SF Find Neighborhoods
columns.description: This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'SF Find Neighborhoods' (6qbp-sg9q) the point in column 'intersection_point' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

columns.name: Current Police Districts
columns.description: This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Current Police Districts' (qgnn-b9vv) the point in column 'intersection_point' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

columns.name: Current Supervisor Districts
columns.description: This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Current Supervisor Districts' (26cr-cadq) the point in column 'intersection_point' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

columns.name: Analysis Neighborhoods
columns.description: This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Analysis Neighborhoods' (ajp5-b2md) the point in column 'intersection_point' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

whom_it_may_interest: Data Analysts, Law Enforcement Agencies, Policy Makers, Public Safety Officials, and Researchers studying emergency response patterns and public safety.

queries.Monthly: SELECT agency, call_type_final_desc, disposition, priority_final, supervisor_district, police_district, analysis_neighborhood, date_trunc_ym(received_datetime) AS month, COUNT(*) AS call_count WHERE received_datetime >= start_date GROUP BY agency, call_type_final_desc, disposition, priority_final, supervisor_district, police_district, analysis_neighborhood, month ORDER BY month
queries.Yearly: SELECT agency, call_type_final_desc, disposition, priority_final, supervisor_district, police_district, analysis_neighborhood, date_trunc_y(received_datetime) AS year, COUNT(*) AS call_count WHERE received_datetime >= start_date GROUP BY agency, call_type_final_desc, disposition, priority_final, supervisor_district, police_district, analysis_neighborhood, year ORDER BY year
